title: Juggernauts in 8.10
body: So as a Juggernaut main i'm just wondering where's all the talks about how The Juggernauts {{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:106}} are going be affected in 8.10 whens adcs get true dmg. It seems all the talks are all about Assassins. Personally I feel that we shouldn't give adc's true dmg because then all their damage just ignore my resistances and Juggernauts need to have the ability to live long enough to do their damage because all their damage potential relies are some that takes time to come into use. Darius needs to stack his bleeds, Garen with his villian passive, Yorick needs his ghouls and maiden, Nasus needs to stack is Q Illoai  needs her tentacles.

replies.body: Juggernauts stack health and very few build heavily in resistances. The true damage won't affect them nearly as much as it will tanks, who have been struggling in everything but the highest levels of organized play much more.

> [{quoted}](name=PopcornBunni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fY9FcEXU,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-05-08T23:03:51.870+0000)

some juggernauts have large passive resistance steroids, and im not just talking about garen. {{champion:2}} has one on his ult aswell.

{{champion:102}} is reliant on the resistances from her passive in regular, and dragon form.

i dont know what the fuck {{champion:27}} counts for, but he is VERY reliant on his ult resistances, since his current meta builds are mainly ap/health stacking.

hes not a jugg either, but what about {{champion:62}} ? is his passive supposed to be entirely useless now?

its to expect, that most fighters at least get around 150 up to 200 armor over the course of a game with their base armor, one or two defensive items, and passive resistances combined.

i really dont think adc should deal even more damage to them, without even bothering with armor pen items, when 3 item crit builds are already shitting on them.

Oh I agree wholeheartedly with you  (on basically everything really. Olaf and Signed are definitely juggernauts despite Riot saying otherwise), I just meant that the impact is going to be worse for a class already struggling.

And coupled with  Stormrazor, Hail of Blades or whatever it's called, and {{item:3087}}, adcs are also going to be bursting squishies with more consistency.

For what it's worth:

Trundle jungle is a very strong counter to Olaf, who's basically S tier in the jungle. He's also strong against a fair number of tanky picks (Sejuani and others) who gain / lose armor over the course of a fight, due to how his ulti works.

Yorrick is also a nightmarish split pusher.

Beyond that.. yeah, eh.

It's fine pretty much every juggernaut main has to deal with their champions not getting anything for a while because juggernauts aren't popular in solo queue and aren't even played in pro play.

at the very least, the threshold of where the new infinity edge is more effective than the old one, should be at 150 armor, and not around 60...

but i hate the idea of how the damage conversion will affect % damage reduction abilities of tanks and fighters. usually these abilities are somehow short windowed and their proper utilization a large part of their kits skill expression.

{{champion:19}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:86}} on top of my head are reliant on their % damage reduction abilities, and they shouldnt just be passively bypassed.

i hope riot changes direction on infinity edge just slightly and swaps the true damage for a more conventional dps increase. there were a couple of good suggestions over the past couple weeks.

- an attack speed buff that activates and is refreshed on crits 
- a ramping up ad bonus like the old fervor of battle
- a stacking armor pen buff, like 3% on every crit against the target, that stacks up to like 30% and resets when the adc switches target

all of those seem a lot healthier than the damage conversion to true damage.

id prefer they replace the true damage on conqueror with an armor pen buff aswell.

Armor pen maybe better and could be healthier for the game.

Juggernauts are in a sad state, they're very weak, the only times Juggernauts ever get viable in high elo is when they can a buse a certain mechanic or item, or when they're just plain overwhelming. You know what's the saddest part about that? people in lower elo tend to think juggernauts are OP, they're not.

I agree with you, worst part is, juggernauts also build a lot of damage, and mostly health, so they don't have a lot of armor and magic resist to begin with, definitely not as much as tanks, they just tend to have a lot of sustain in their kits and are heavily rewarded for reaching an enemy.

Sadly Juggernauts are bound to never be top tier due to their lack of mobility, because if Riot were to ever buff Juggernaut mobility they'd become OP.

Maybe riot doesn't have to buff their mobility but the biggest thing that affects juggernauts is cc and they have no way to counter like the other classes do. Maybe we can give them an item that gives unstoppable status on activation. It could make them a little more viable and it can still be played around because it will a cool down.
